entry.title: Version 1.2.3
entry.summary: Seasonal Update - Christmas Arrives! (Part III | Final)
entry.markdown:
[Performance] Texture optimization pass completed using external research techniques: Mod size reduced from 953 MB → 781 MB, improving efficiency without sacrificing quality.
[Adjustments] Frontend overlay updated — replaced the wreath with a more subtle frost overlay for a cleaner winter aesthetic. Blizzards added to Fort Deen and Frontier: Snow particles now appear across nearly all regions, creating a fully immersive winter atmosphere. Controller Sentinel creeps added to Sentry as part of the Rebels faction: 4 Controller Sentinels can now be found scattered around key points of interest. Leader Power icon updates: Ravakteus — Overwatch Protocol now has a unique icon. Spartan Jacob — Tactical Override now has a unique icon. The Tyrant (Rtapa’ Vonamai) — Rapid Advance now has a unique icon. The Mercenary (Syzo ’Vrarum) — Cloak Tower Drop now has a unique icon. All UNSC and Vanquished units reskinned with festive accent highlights: Subtle gold, red, and rich green detailing applied across units. Team colors remain fully identifiable to preserve gameplay clarity.
[Notess]This concludes the Christmas Update; thank you for playing, and happy holidays!!!

entry.title: Version 1.2.2
entry.markdown: ALL maps have now been snow-covered, with nearly every surface fully retextured to embrace the winter theme. Blizzards will begin rolling in as Christmas approaches, expected around December 20th–24th. UNSC units and buildings redesigned with a festive Christmas aesthetic: Team colors remain intact for clarity. Units now feature gold, red, and rich green accents for a seasonal flair. The Vanquished festive redesign is still in progress and will debut in a later update. Map loading screens updated to reflect the Christmas theme; covers coming soon. A large portion of the UI has been reskinned to match the holiday aesthetic. Splash screen updated to take on a new festive holiday look. A preview of an incoming blizzard may now be seen on Fort Deen, particularly near the center of the map.

entry.title: Version 1.2.1
entry.markdown: Splash screen fully updated to reflect the Christmas theme. All grass textures have been replaced with snow, giving most maps a festive winter appearance. Maps and other features will continue to grow progressively snowier and colder as December approaches — stay tuned for more updates!
